## Description {#details}

Builder class for ExecutionEngines.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> this by stack-allocating a builder, chaining the various set&#42; methods, and terminating it with a .<a href="#aaccaa0649b2f09dfcb7123300ccd3d19">create()</a> call.

Definition at line 534 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/executionengine-h">ExecutionEngine.h</a>.

### setMCJITMemoryManager() {#a158be06e8bc0c3e9caafba69adadaaa4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>EngineBuilder &amp; EngineBuilder::setMCJITMemoryManager (std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager">RTDyldMemoryManager</a> &gt; mcjmm)</>}>
setMCJITMemoryManager - Sets the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> memory manager to use.

This allows clients to customize their memory allocation policies for the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a>. This is only appropriate for the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a>; setting this and configuring the builder to create anything other than <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> will cause a runtime error. If <a href="#aaccaa0649b2f09dfcb7123300ccd3d19">create()</a> is called and is successful, the created engine takes ownership of the memory manager. This option defaults to NULL.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/executionengine-h/#l00574">574</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/executionengine-h">ExecutionEngine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/executionengine-cpp/#l00485">485</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/executionengine-cpp">ExecutionEngine.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setMCPU() {#abeb3f9f8b01e92ccf434c556cdb5afd0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>EngineBuilder &amp; llvm::EngineBuilder::setMCPU (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> mcpu)</>}
